oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Treatment of and negotiations of and negotiations with the Cherokee Indians in the first administration of John Sevier, first Governor of Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A pamphlet that was published as “Monograph No. 1 of the Papers of the Tennessee Society of Colonial Dames of America, Printed for the Society at the University Press of Sewanee Tennessee.” This pamphlet is based on research of a committee of the DAR that researched the original records of correspondence of Tennessee Governor John Sevier, regarding the negotiations with the Cherokee Indians. Forms part of the Ophelia Payne Collection, 1 pamphlet.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sevier, John, 1745-1815
National Society of the Colonial Dames of America, in Tennessee
Cherokee Indians--Government relations
Tennessee. -- Governor (1796-1801 : Sevier); Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources

oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Ophelia Payne Collection Nashville History Papers 001
